required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Activ-L™ Artificial Disc Treatment of Degenerative Disc Disease in the Treatment of Degenerative Disc Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of the Aesculap Activ-L™ Artificial Disc in the Treatment of Degenerative Disc Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to learn whether an investigational device called the Activ-L Artificial Disc is safe and effective in the treatment of degenerative disc disease of the lower (lumbar) spine.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this clinical study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the Activ-L Artificial Disc for treatment of single-level degenerative disc disease of the lumbar spine in patients who have been unresponsive to at least six months of prior conservative care. The hypothesis of the study is that the Activ-L Disc is non-inferior to the control (the Charité® Artificial Disc [DePuy Spine] or ProDisc-L® Total Disc Replacement [Synthes Spine]) with respect to the rate of individual subject success at 24 months. Individual subject success is a composite of effectiveness and safety.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Success at 24 Months Relative to Baseline
primary_outcome.description: Measured by absence of treatment failure; absence or serious device related AE; maintenance or improvement of ROM at index level; maintenance or improvement of neurological status; improvement in ODI score.
Percent of subjects demonstrating no Subsequent Surgical Interventions (SSI's) at the index level (L4-L5 or L5-S1) at 24 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Absence of Serious Device Related Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: Percent of subjects demonstrating no device related SAE's at 24 months as per the Clinical Events Committee (CEC)
Percent of subjects demonstrating maintenance or improvement in ROM at 24 months compared to baseline
Percent of patients demonstrating maintenance or improvement in combined motor and sensory evaluations at 24 months compared to baseline
Percent of subjects demonstrating an improvement of greater than or equal to 15 points at 24 months compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: VAS Success for Back and Leg Pain at Rest
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients demonstrating improvement in back and leg pain at 24 months compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: ODI Success Using Two Measures of Success
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects demonstrating improvement in two measures of ODI success at 24 months compared to baseline
Number of subjects demonstrating a greater than or equal to 15% improvement in mental (MCS) and physical (PCS) component summary scores at 24 months compared to baseline

arm_group.description: Implantation of the Activ-L Artificial Disc at one level of the lumbar spine, either L4/L5 or L5/S1.
Implantation of either the ProDisc-L Total Disc Replacement or Charité Artificial Disc at one level of the lumbar spine, either L4/L5 or L5/S1.

intervention.description: Implantation at one level of the lumbar spine, either L4/L5 or L5/S1.

intervention.intervention_name: ProDisc-L Total Disc Replacement or Charité Artificial Disc
intervention.description: Implantation at one level of the lumbar spine, either L4/L5 or L5/S1.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 - 60, skeletally mature
- Symptomatic DDD with objective evidence of lumbar DDD, with any of the following characteristics by MRI scan:
- instability as defined by ≥ 3mm translation or ≥ 5° angulation.
- osteophyte formation of facet joints or vertebral endplates.
- decreased disc height of >2mm as compared to the adjacent level.
- scarring/thickening of the ligamentum flavum, annulus fibrosis, or facet joint capsule.
- herniated nucleus pulposus.
- facet joint degeneration/changes.
- vacuum phenomenon.
- Single level symptomatic disease at L4/L5 or L5/S1.
- six months of unsuccessful conservative treatment
- ODI score ≥ 40/100.
- Surgical candidate for an anterior approach to the lumbar spine.
- Back pain at the operative level only, with or without leg pain.
- Back pain VAS score greater than the higher of the two VAS leg pain scores.
- VAS back pain score ≥ 40/100 mm.
- Willing to return for follow-up visits and sign an Informed Consent and HIPAA Authorization.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous surgery at any lumbar level, except IDET (Intradiscal Electrothermal Annuloplasty), percutaneous nucleoplasty, or microdiscectomy.
- Chronic radiculopathy, i.e., subject complaint of unremitting pain with a predominance of leg pain symptoms greater than back pain symptoms extending over a period of at least 1 year.
- endplate dimensions smaller than 34.5 mm in medial-lateral and/or 27 mm in the anterior-posterior direction
- Evidence of significant, symptomatic disc degeneration at another lumbar level.
- Preoperative remaining disc height < 3mm
- Myelopathy.
- Previous compression or burst fracture at the affected level.
- Sequestered herniated nucleus pulposus with migration.
- Mid-sagittal stenosis of <8mm (by MRI).
- Degenerative or lytic spondylolisthesis > 3mm.
- Spondylolysis.
- Isthmic spondylolisthesis.
- Lumbar scoliosis (> 11 degrees of sagittal plane deformity).
- Spinal tumor.
- Active systemic infection or infection at the site of surgery.
- Facet ankylosis or severe facet degeneration.
- Continuing steroid use or prior use for more than 2 months.
- History of allergies to any of the device components.
- Pregnancy or planning to become pregnant within the next 2 years.
- Morbid obesity (BMI >35).
- Investigational drug or device use within 30 days.
- Osteoporosis or osteopenia
- Metabolic bone disease.
- Leg pain with migrated sequestrum fragment.
- History of rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, or other autoimmune disorder.
- Ankylosing spondylitis.
- History of HIV/AIDS or hepatitis that precludes surgery.
- History of deep vein thrombosis, symptoms of arterial insufficiency, or thromboembolytic disease.
- Current or recent history of illicit drug or alcohol abuse, or dependence as defined as the continued use of alcohol despite the development of social, legal, or health problems.
- Life expectancy <5 years.
- Chemotherapy within past 5 years or any cancer other than non-melanoma skin cancer treated with curative intent within the past 5 years.
- Prior nephrectomy.
- Abdominal adhesions, endometriosis, inflammatory bowel disease, Crohn's disease, diverticulitis, ulcerative colitis or other abdominal pathology that would preclude abdominal surgical approach.
- Insulin-dependent diabetes.
- Any degenerative muscular or neurological condition that would interfere with evaluation of outcomes, including but not limited to Parkinson's disease, ALS (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis), or multiple sclerosis.
- History of Pelvic Inflammatory Disease.
- Peritonitis.
- Currently in active spinal litigation as a result of medical negligence.
- Prisoner.
- Psychiatric or cognitive impairment that would interfere with the subject's ability to comply with the study requirements, e.g., Alzheimer's disease.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were screened and enrolled at 19 US health care center sites

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) Scores for Low Back Pain
measure.description: Scores on a scale from 0 (minimal disability) to 100 (bed-bound)

measure.title: Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Ratings for Back and Leg Pain
measure.description: Ratings on a scale from 0 (no pain) to 100 (worst possible pain)

measure.title: Short-Form (36) Health Questionnaire (SF-36) Scores
measure.description: Scores on a scale from 0 (maximum disability) to 100 (no disability) for mental component summary (MCS) and physical component summary (PCS)

measure.title: Normal Neurological Status
measure.description: Number of subjects meeting the following criteria for normal status: Motor - Grade 5 (active movement vs. full resistance); Sensory - Grade 2 (normal); Reflexes - Grade 2 (normal)

outcome.title: Overall Success at 24 Months Relative to Baseline
outcome.description: Measured by absence of treatment failure; absence or serious device related AE; maintenance or improvement of ROM at index level; maintenance or improvement of neurological status; improvement in ODI score.
outcome.population: Intent to treat population; missing data imputed as failures

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The trial was designed as a non-inferiority trial with a margin (delta) of 15%. Additional analyses using a delta of 10% as requested by FDA were also conducted.

outcome.title: VAS Success for Back and Leg Pain at Rest
outcome.description: Number of patients demonstrating improvement in back and leg pain at 24 months compared to baseline
outcome.population: Intent to treat population; observed data (i.e. missing data not imputed as failures)

event.description: Includes arrhythmia, chest pain, heart disease and myocardial infarct

event.sub_title: Eyes, Ears, Nose or Throat Issues

event.description: Includes esophageal bleeding and esophagitis
Includes abdominal pain, stomach flu, gastric infection and peptic ulcer
Includes appendicitis and bowel obstruction
Includes weight gain, colonoscopy and hernia repair
Includes cholecystectomy, cholecystitis and gallstones
Includes motor vehicle accident, fall, trip, slip or twist
Includes arthritis, facet joint degeneration and rheumatoid arthritis
Includes inflammatory polyarthritis
Includes ganglion cyst, hallux rigidus, hip-joint pain, surgery, torn meniscus and trigger finger
Includes disc bulge and disc herniation
Includes neck and thoracic

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.description: Includes breast, colon, prostate, rectal, skin and vulvar
Includes bilateral lower leg, unilateral upper and lower leg

event.sub_title: Lumbar and Lower Extremeties Sensory Deficit
Lumbar and Lower Extremities Motor Deficit
event.description: Includes general and transient unilateral motor deficit
Includes lumbar + unilateral and bilateral radiation into upper and lower leg
Includes brain tumor, headache, loss of consciousness, nerve entrapment, seizure, vertigo and carpal tunnel syndrome
Includes pregnancy, delivery and miscarriages
Includes conversion disorder, depression and suicidal attempt
Includes substance dependence and withdrawal
Includes kidney stones
Includes breast implant leakage, irregular menstrual bleeding and ovarian or uterine cyst or mass or tumor
Includes erectile dysfunction and retrograde ejaculation
Includes breast reduction or enhancement and hysterectomy
Includes dyspnea
Includes bronchitis and pneumonia
Includes implant expulsion, malposition, migration and subsidence
Includes deep wounds, dural injuries and incisional hernia

event.sub_title: Subsequent Surgical Intervention Procedure Related Wounds
event.description: Includes incisional hernia
Includes syncope
Includes pulmonary embolism
Includes deep vein thrombosis
Includes aneurysm, atherosclerosis and iliac vessel tear
Includes arrhythmia, chest pain, heart disease and myocardial infarct
Includes abdominal adhesion, abdominal pain, acid reflux, indigestion, food poisoning, GERD, gastric lesions, gastritis, stomach flu, gastrointestinal infection and peptic ulcer
Includes bowel irregularity, constipation, diverticulitis, GI bleed, inflammatory bowel syndrome, nausea, vomiting and diarrhea
Includes seasonal and systemic allergic reactions
Includes abscess, cellulitis and non-procedure wound infections
Includes motor vehicle accident, fall, trip, slip or twist
Includes ankylosing spondylitis, arthritis, arthropathy and facet joint degeneration

Includes non-lumbar benign mass or tumor, bursitis, ganglion cyst, gout, hallux rigidus, hiccups, hip joint pain, non-lumbar joint sprain, leg length discrepancy, SI joint pain, surgery, torn meniscus, torn hip labral tear and trigger finger
Includes ankle, back, upper extremities, neck and thoracic, fibromyalgia, and foot

event.sub_title: Lumbar and Lower Extremity Motor Deficit
event.description: Includes general, persistent and transient unilateral and bilateral motor deficit

event.sub_title: Lumbar and Lower Extremity Sensory Deficit
event.description: Includes unilateral and bilateral general and upper extremity sensory deficit, positive or change in SLR test

Includes Bell's palsy, brain tumor, dysphagia, memory loss, headache, loss of consciousness, migraine, nerve entrapment, numbness, restlessness, seizure, tremor, vertigo, carpal tunnel, peripheral neuropathy, upper extremity motor/sensory deficits
Includes unilateral and bilateral upper and lower leg
Includes lumbar + unilateral and bilateral radiation into upper and lower leg
Includes pregnancy and delivery
Includes anxiety, bipolar and depressive disorders
Includes substance dependence or withdrawal
Includes fatigue, sleepiness, somnolence and insomnia
Includes decreased urine output, bladder infection, hematuria, incontinence, dysuria, pelvic pain, urinary hesitance, retention, urgency or tract infection
Includes epididymitis, erectile dysfunction, inguinal or testicular pain, rectocele and retrograde ejaculation
Includes abnormal PAP smear results, breast, ovarian or uterine cyst, mass or tumor, cystocele, menopause, vaginal or yeast infection
Includes abortion, hysterectomy and lumpectomy
Includes dyspnea, sleep apnea, cough and asthma
Includes bronchitis, respiratory and sinus infection
Includes COPD, hemoptysis, pleuritic chest pain, reactive airway disease
Includes disc bulge, protrusion and herniation
Includes abscess, deep wound, dehiscence, dural injuries, erythema, drainage, inflammation, incisional hernia, incisional cellulitis, pain at incision site, suture reaction and wound infection
Includes hypertension and syncope
Includes aneurysm, arterial dissection, atherosclerosis and iliac vessel tear

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Associate Director of Medical and Scientific Affairs
